meanings.definition: Unable to be appeased or pacified.
meanings.sent1: Her implacability nature made it impossible to calm her down once she was upset.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's implacability towards late assignments was well-known among the students.
meanings.sent3: Despite his implacability, his friends managed to surprise him with a birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The storm's implacability pounded the coast with unrelenting force.
meanings.sent5: The implacability of the judge's decision left no room for negotiation.

meanings.definition: Unyielding or relentless in attitude or manner.
meanings.sent1: The implacability boss never accepted excuses for unfinished work.
meanings.sent2: His implacability determination to succeed drove him to work long hours.
meanings.sent3: The implacability toddler refused to eat anything but macaroni and cheese.
meanings.sent4: The implacability march of time stops for no one.
meanings.sent5: The implacability pursuit of justice kept the detective on the case day and night.
